net.datacrow.core

Class DcConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.datacrow.core.DcConfig

  • public class DcConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Data Crow Configuration. For each Data Crow instance (server or client) this class is used to store the environment settings. It holds all the applicable folder locations, the Connector for accessing the database and general information on the platform on which Data Crow is running.
    Author:
    Robert Jan van der Waals

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int _OPERATING_MODE_CLIENT
      Running as a client, connected to a server
      static int _OPERATING_MODE_SERVER

      static int _OPERATING_MODE_STANDALONE
      Running as a stand-alone client, not connected to a server

      • isDataCrowStarted

        public boolean isDataCrowStarted()
        Check to see whether Data Crow has been fully started. When Data Crow has been started the settings, database, etc. can be safely consulted.
        Returns:
        started y/n

      • setDataCrowStarted

        public void setDataCrowStarted(boolean started)
        This method is used to indicate that Data Crow has been fully started. This is set by the class DcStarter will set this property.
        Parameters:
        started - indicator whether Data Crow has been started.

      • getClientSettings

        public ClientSettings getClientSettings()
        Returns the client settings. The client settings hold information such as the selected user directory.
        Returns:
        ClientSettings the initiated client settings.

      • getOperatingMode

        public int getOperatingMode()
        The operating is one of the following: _OPERATING_MODE_CLIENT _OPERATING_MODE_SERVER _OPERATING_MODE_STANDALONE
        Returns:
        The operating mode of this session.

      • setOperatingMode

        public void setOperatingMode(int operatingMode)
        Sets the Operating Mode. This is determined on startup, based on the parameters provided by the implementers of the datacrow-core library.
        Parameters:
        operatingMode - _OPERATING_MODE_CLIENT, _OPERATING_MODE_SERVER or _OPERATING_MODE_STANDALONE

      • setClientSettings

        public void setClientSettings(ClientSettings clientSettings)
        Set the client settings. The client settings hold information such as the selected user folder.
        Parameters:
        clientSettings - the current client settings, used by this session

      • setRestartMode

        public void setRestartMode(boolean b)
        Indicate that Data Crow is current restarting.
        Parameters:
        b - indicator whether Data Crow is restarting.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this configuration from all values (NULL).

      • getDatabaseName

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseName()
        Returns the currently used database (the name of the database).
        Returns:
        name of the database.

      • setDatabaseName

        public void setDatabaseName(java.lang.String db)
        Set the name of the database as currently used by Data Crow.
        Parameters:
        db - the name of the database.

      • setConnector

        public void setConnector(Connector connector)
        Sets the connector. The connector is used for querying, saving, loading and deleting information from and to the database. The connector is the connection layer for every implementor of the datacrow-core library.
        Parameters:
        connector - the connector to be used within the current session.

      • getConnector

        public Connector getConnector()
        Returns the currently used connector. The connector is used for querying, saving, loading and deleting information from and to the database. The connector is the connection layer for every implementor of the datacrow-core library.
        Returns:
        the currently used connector.

      • getPlatform

        public Platform getPlatform()
        Returns the platform class instance holding generic information on the Operating System and Java VM Data Crow is currently running on.
        Returns:
        the platform information class instance.

      • isAllowLoadSettings

        public boolean isAllowLoadSettings()
        Indicates whether Data Crow is allowed to load the user settings. The correct implementation is to set this value based on parameter supplied by the user on startup. When set to true, only the default setting values (as installed with Data Crow) will be loaded.
        Returns:
        allow settings to be loaded y/n

      • getVersion

        public Version getVersion()
        Returns the current application version information.
        Returns:
        the current Data Crow application version.

      • getInstallationDir

        public java.lang.String getInstallationDir()
        Returns the installation directory (fully qualified path). This is the main Data Crow directory.
        Returns:
        the Data Crow installation folder

      • setInstallationDir

        public void setInstallationDir(java.lang.String installationDir)
        Sets the Data Crow installation directory (fully qualified path).
        Parameters:
        installationDir - the installation folder

      • getImageDir

        public java.lang.String getImageDir()
        Returns the image directory (fully qualified path). This folder holds all images such as screenshots. For instances running as a client (connected to a server) this path will be NULL as the images will be hosted by the server instead.
        Returns:
        the Data Crow installation folder.

      • setImageDir

        public void setImageDir(java.lang.String imageDir)
        Set the image directory. his folder holds all images such as screenshots. For instances running as a client (connected to a server) this path will be ignored as the images are hosted by the Server instead.
        Parameters:
        imageDir - fully qualified image path.

      • getServicesDir

        public java.lang.String getServicesDir()
        Returns the online services directory (fully qualified path). The services folder holds the JAR files of the implemented online services. Typically this folder is located within the installation directory of Data Crow.
        Returns:
        the services directory, fully qualified path

      • setServicesDir

        Parameters:
        servicesDir - the services directory, fully qualified path

      • getDatabaseDir

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseDir()
        Returns the database directory (fully qualified path). This folder holds the Data Crow database. Will be NULL when running as a client connected to a server as the server is the owner of the database in this case.
        Returns:
        the database directory, fully qualified path

      • setDatabaseDir

        public void setDatabaseDir(java.lang.String databaseDir)
        Sets the database directory (fully qualified path). This folder holds the Data Crow database. Should be NULL when running as a client connected to a server as the server is the owner of the database in this case.
        Parameters:
        databaseDir -
